title: are cse and cse(aiml) considered to be the same branch?
content: during GPA calculation, as a student in cse(aiml) will you be competing with fellow aiml students or the entire cse dept of that campus (1k+ students)?

comments.body: No one knows since the first batch of AIML students just started their 3rd sem
ahh okay, could someone from that batch please answer, if possible?

Competing \*for\* what? 

Placements? Then yes they will be competing with core CS and their own branch (along with ECE and other branches that are allowed to sit). 

Scholarships? No, Scholarships are always intra-department. 

PESU trauma? That hits everyone here :')
thanks:) I was just wondering about the GPA, though; would the student's GPA be wrt their aiml batchmates (some 300 of them) or wrt cs+ cs(aiml) (some 1k+ students) in a particular campus?
GPA is not relative, it's absolute. So it's irrelevant. There's an FAQ post on this sub that explains the calculation of GPA if you're interested.
Ah okay, sorry, my bad... will check it out. Thank you
It seems kindaa..experimental to join aiml and there would also be lack of seniors to guide you so wouldn't recommend it...keeping in mind about boom and necessity of Ai
Hmm true, are you a senior though?
Nope joining August 28 th in EC campus cse
Nope joining August 28th in EC campus cse
